issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Hello,

The *hyperloop latest version 3.0.1* does not bundle with the latest *SDK 7.0.0.GA* but when we manually download the module then it's working.

*keynotes of this issue:*
1. Customer is only using CLI and update everything from CLI
2. When they updated the latest SDK by using CLI then the Hyperloop does not update

*Hyperloop module shows below error:* 
{code}
[WARN] Could not find a valid Titanium module id=hyperloop version=latest platform=windows deploy-type=development 
[ERROR] Found incompatible Titanium Modules: 
[ERROR] id: hyperloop version: 2.1.3 platform: windows min sdk: 6.1.1 
[ERROR] id: hyperloop version: 2.1.2 platform: windows min sdk: 6.1.1 
[ERROR] id: hyperloop version: 2.1.3 platform: windows min sdk: 6.1.1 
[ERROR] id: hyperloop version: 2.1.2 platform: windows min sdk: 6.1.1 
{code}

*Current Results:*
Hyperloop does not update with the latest SDK

*Expected Results:*
The latest Hyperloop 3.0.1 should be bundled with SDK 7.0.0.GA 

Note: Reference which said "[Highlights for this release include integration of Hyperloop in the SDK core|http://docs.appcelerator.com/platform/latest/#!/guide/Titanium_SDK_Release_Notes]"

Thanks
fields.summary: Windows: Hyperloop module latest version (3.0.1) does not bundle with latest SDK 7.0.0.GA

comments.body: [~mrahman] I'm not seeing this behaviour, when I download 7.0.0.GA on Windows (or any build from 7_0_X or master) hyperloop 3.0.1 is downloaded and installed on the system.
Hi [~eharris], Yes I have tested this issue and download the latest SDK using following command {code}[appc] ti sdk install latest{code} Seems it's not an issue. I have also replied to the customer.
[~mrahman] Did you hear back from the customer on this? I'd like to close this out
